end.title: Cleverman
end.creator_credit: Goalpost Pictures, Ryan Griffen, Jane Allen, Pukeko Pictures, Damir Peranovic, Jacob Nash and ABC-TV (Australia)
end.brief_description: Cleverman stormed onto ABC TV in 2016 as a dystopian sci-fi with a difference. With predominantly Indigenous cast and senior crew, the series explores a series of Aboriginal origin stories in a contemporary context, with political nuance touching on themes of class, racism and power.

constellations_other.description: Jedda was the first fully funded Australian feature to be shot on colour film. It was also the first Australian film with Aboriginal actors in lead roles, however, it reflects a deeply problematic time in Australian history.

links.description: Djali is played by Hunter Page-Lochard, who also starred as another young Indigenous man on a journey of self-discovery, but this time it’s to discover his superpowers in Cleverman, which was ground-breaking for Indigenous self-representation by being the first TV show about an Indigenous superhero.

links.description: Yolngu actor Rarriwuy Hick’s breakout role was as Latani in Cleverman from 2016. In 2018, she took up the iconic role of Ruby Mitchell in Wentworth and collaborated with the writers to better represent the Indigenous experience.

constellations_other.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_other.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

constellations_other.name: Aboriginal History Archive
constellations_other.description: The Aboriginal History Archive at Victoria University, led by Gary Foley, is dedicated to the collection and preservation of First Peoples' stories and cultural material. The political activism of the Black Power movement in the 1970s is intersected with representation of Aboriginal actors on screen.

links.description: Hick appeared in the sixth season of Wentworth alongside longtime friend Leah Purcell, who played Ruby’s older sister Rita Connors in Wentworth. Not only had Purcell directed Hick in Cleverman, they’d both also appeared in Redfern Now.

end.brief_description: Kutcha’s Carpool Koorioke is about strong Aboriginal connection with place and the artists who have songs that have held us, given us strength in the dark times and always brought us together.

links.description: John Harvey has also lent his talents to the small screen, directing Mutti Mutti songman Kutcha Edwards in Kutcha’s Carpool Koorioke, which adapts the Carpool Karaoke format for a musical tour through Wurundjeri country featuring First Peoples musicians.
